title: Ed Sheeran crowned Britain’s richest celebrity under 30 as Adele turns 31
text:
Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Ed Sheeran has nabbed the title of Britain’s richest celebrity under the age of 30 after Adele turned 31 and no longer qualified for the list.

The 28-year-old musician topped the annual list, compiled by Heat Magazine, with a fortune of £170million - almost twice as much as his 2018 value.

The list of the nation’s wealthiest young stars is made up of well-known musicians, film stars, models and TV personalities.

Coming in second for 2019 is 30-year-old actor Daniel Radcliffe with a fortune of £90million, mostly made up from his Harry Potter franchise earnings.

(Image: Reuters)

(Image: Columbia Pictures)

The top five is completed by 25-year-old Harry Styles with £64million, 29-year-old actress Emma Watson with £57million and 26-year-old Irishman Niall Horan with £54.8million in the bank.

Former One Direction star Harry’s fortune is made of income from his 1D days, his solo career and a deal with Gucci.

Stormzy and Dua Lipa are this year’s highest ranking new entries to the annual rich list, coming in at 14th and 15th place respectively with fortunes of £12million and £11.8million each.

(Image: PA)

Just missing out on a top five spot are the Little Mix girls, with a combined fortune of £50million.

One Direction stars Louis Tomlinson (£46million), Liam Payne (£44million) and Zayn Malik (£38million) came in at 7th, 8th and 10th place respectively.

Supermodel Cara Delevingne is the only other woman to feature in the top ten with a fortune of £39.5million.

(Image: mirror.co.uk)

While seen as unlucky for some, 13th place was occupied by Rita Ora who is rumoured to have £17.8million in the bank.

British stars Sophie Turner (£8.5million) and Dev Patel (£7.5million) made it into 17th and 20th place respectively with fortunes from their blossoming acting careers.

TOWIE star and businesswoman Sam Faiers was the highest earning reality star, bagging £6.3million, with former Love Island stars Olivia and Alex Bowen on the list with £4.3million.

(Image: Getty Images)

Globally, Kylie Jenner continues to reign supreme taking home an eye-watering fortune of £736million over the last 12 months.

Also featuring in the top earning global youngsters are Taylor Swift with £319million, Justin Bieber with £272million, Miley Cyrus with £175million and Jennifer Lawrence with £105 million.

Zoella topped the list of the richest female social influencers, with the 29-year-old pocketing £4.7million.

Instagram sensation and queen of clean Mrs Hitch came in 5th with a million pounds in the bank.

description: The 28-year-old singer topped Heat magazine's annual list of the richest musicians, models and actors in the country
